org.cojen.tupl

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cojen.tupl.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class Database
extends Object
    Main database class, containing a collection of transactional indexes. Call open to obtain a Database instance. Examples:

    Open a non-durable database, limited to a max size of 100MB: 

     DatabaseConfig config = new DatabaseConfig().maxCacheSize(100_000_000);
 Database db = Database.open(config);

    Open a regular database, setting the minimum cache size to ensure enough memory is initially available. A weak durability mode offers the best transactional commit performance. 

     DatabaseConfig config = new DatabaseConfig()
    .baseFilePath("/var/lib/tupl")
    .minCacheSize(100_000_000)
    .durabilityMode(DurabilityMode.NO_FLUSH);

 Database db = Database.open(config);

    The following files are created by the above example:

    • /var/lib/tupl.db – primary data file
    • /var/lib/tupl.info – text file describing the database configuration
    • /var/lib/tupl.lock – lock file to ensure that at most one process can have the database open
    • /var/lib/tupl.redo.0 – first transaction redo log file

    New redo log files are created by checkpoints, which also delete the old files. When snapshots are in progress, one or more numbered temporary files are created. For example: /var/lib/tupl.temp.123.

    Author:
    Brian S O'Neill
    See Also:
    DatabaseConfig

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • allIndexes

        public Cursor allIndexes()
                  throws IOException
        Returns a Cursor which maps all available index names to identifiers. Identifiers are long integers, big-endian encoded. Attempting to store anything into the Cursor causes an UnmodifiableViewException to be thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • newTransaction

        public Transaction newTransaction()
        Returns a new Transaction with the default durability mode.

      • newTransaction

        public Transaction newTransaction(DurabilityMode durabilityMode)
        Returns a new Transaction with the given durability mode. If null, the default is used.

      • preallocate

        public long preallocate(long bytes)
                 throws IOException
        Preallocates pages for immediate use. The actual amount allocated varies, depending on the amount of free pages already available.
        Returns:
        actual amount allocated
        Throws:
        IOException

      • beginSnapshot

        public Snapshot beginSnapshot()
                       throws IOException
        Support for capturing a snapshot (hot backup) of the database, while still allowing concurrent modifications. The snapshot contains all data up to the last checkpoint. Call the checkpoint method immediately before to ensure that an up-to-date snapshot is captured.

        To restore from a snapshot, store it in the primary data file, which is the base file with a ".db" extension. Make sure no redo log files exist and then open the database. Alternatively, call restoreFromSnapshot, which also supports restoring into separate data files.

        During the snapshot, temporary files are created to hold pre-modified copies of pages. If the snapshot destination stream blocks for too long, these files keep growing. File growth rate increases too if the database is being heavily modified. In the worst case, the temporary files can become larger than the primary database files.

        Returns:
        a snapshot control object, which must be closed when no longer needed
        Throws:
        IOException

      • restoreFromSnapshot

        public static Database restoreFromSnapshot(DatabaseConfig config,
                           InputStream in)
                                    throws IOException
        Restore from a snapshot, into the data files defined by the given configuration.
        Parameters:
        in - snapshot source; does not require extra buffering; auto-closed
        Throws:
        IOException

      • stats

        public Database.Stats stats()
        Returns an immutable copy of database statistics.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws IOException
        Flushes, but does not sync, all non-flushed transactions. Transactions committed with no-flush effectively become no-sync durable.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • sync

        public void sync()
          throws IOException
        Persists all non-flushed and non-sync'd transactions. Transactions committed with no-flush and no-sync effectively become sync durable.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • checkpoint

        public void checkpoint()
                throws IOException
        Durably sync and checkpoint all changes to the database. In addition to ensuring that all transactions are durable, checkpointing ensures that non-transactional modifications are durable. Checkpoints are performed automatically by a background thread, at a configurable rate.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • verify

        public boolean verify(VerificationObserver observer)
               throws IOException
        Verifies the integrity of the database and all indexes.
        Parameters:
        observer - optional observer; pass null for default
        Returns:
        true if verification passed
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the database, ensuring durability of committed transactions. No checkpoint is performed by this method, and so non-transactional modifications can be lost.
        Throws:
        IOException
